Despite sanctions, Russia's 'shadow fleet' keeps delivering oil
subhead: The European Union has adopted a new round of sanctions targeting Russia's 'shadow fleet,' which is used to bypass Western restrictions. But loopholes and weak oversight have significantly undermined their effectiveness.

subhead: In an op-ed for Le Monde, a group of individuals imprisoned in Russia for their civic stances urges political leaders and the media in democratic countries to support their fight for civil liberties.

subhead: Family planning, combating maternal and child mortality and HIV care: In many areas, NGOs fear a 'historic setback' six months after the US halted its funding.

headline: Ozzy Osbourne, one of the last legends of heavy metal, has died at 76
subhead: The singer and co-founder of Black Sabbath also enjoyed a successful solo career after leaving the British band. The 'Prince of Darkness' died on Tuesday morning, his family announced.

headline: From Gaza to Amman, how UNRWA's family archives were rescued under fire
subhead: Documents attesting to the refugee status of hundreds of thousands of Palestinians were taken out of Gaza in the early months of the war and stored safely in Jordan. Le Monde tells the story of this previously unreported secret operation.

headline: Conor the parrot, a somber allegory for Ukraine's trauma
subhead: After the death of his owner, Anton, Conor withered and appeared to lose the will to live. Tatiana, the widow, could no longer bear to hear him speak in 'the same intonations' as Anton.
